div.p: RB MSS 439c, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

This letter is among those received by Guilfoyle from M. It was evidently written after 31 May 1873, the date on which M was informed that he was being relieved of the directorship of the Botanic Garden, but before Guilfoyle sailed from Sydney per You Yangs for Melbourne on 19 June. It would appear that M was not yet aware that Guilfoyle would be taking over at the Botanic Garden. For a printed version of the text, see R. Pescott (1974), pp. 69-70, where it is presented, most implausibly, as an offer of assistance from M to the man he knew was to succeed him at the Botanic Garden.
I should be glad, my dear friend, if you will first of all look for me, when you arrive. Meanwhile I can only say, that I am disgraced and degraded as Director and that I have been forced out of my creation suddenly after 21 years without a single word of thanks for my honorary Directorship since 1857.

div.p:
My salary, House rent & £300 are left me for my whole Department The Clerk to be paid out of the £300
Marginal note.

I appreciate your generosity regarding the shares, but cannot write more just now
Note written, upside down, at head of letter.

At the University already Prof M'Coy & Dr Bird
Samuel Dougan Bird was the University’s lecturer in materia medica from 1869. are lecturing. I am not wanted there, even if my pulmonary disease allowed me to do so
Note written, upside down, on back of letter.
